sessions.title: New Chat
sessions.transcript: 1. What “Offboarding” Means at Capitec  At Capitec Bank, offboarding is not a single event (e.g. “close account”), but a controlled lifecycle transition where the bank terminates or restricts a client relationship while ensuring:  No unmanaged credit exposure  Regulatory compliance (FICA, NCA, POPIA, SARB prudential standards)  Consistent, fair client treatment  Data, funds, and obligations are lawfully resolved  There are two fundamentally different offboarding paths:  A. Client with NO active credit  B. Client WITH active credit (personal or business) ← this is the high-risk path  Your earlier risk statement correctly identifies that Path B is the real problem area.  2. Offboarding Triggers (How the Process Starts)  Offboarding at Capitec is trigger-driven, not voluntary in most cases.  Primary trigger categories 2.1 Client-initiated  Client requests account closure  Emigration / death / insolvency  Business closure (Business Bank)  2.2 Bank-initiated (risk-driven)  FICA non-compliance (expired or failed KYC)  Fraud or financial crime indicators  Sanctions / AML flags  Misuse of products  Reputational or regulatory risk  2.3 Credit-driven triggers  Persistent delinquency  Default or legal escalation  Debt review / sequestration  Credit agreement termination events  Key point: Once credit exists, offboarding is legally constrained. The bank cannot simply “exit” the client.  3. Client Segmentation Before Offboarding  Before any action, Capitec segments the client:  Dimension	Why it matters Product mix	Transactional vs loan vs overdraft vs credit card Credit status	Performing / delinquent / default Legal status	Debt review, deceased estate, business liquidation Risk flags	Fraud, AML, sanctions Portfolio	Personal Bank vs Business Bank  This segmentation determines what Capitec is legally allowed to do next.  4. Offboarding WITHOUT Credit (Low Complexity)  If the client has no active credit facilities:  Step-by-step  Balance settlement  Account must be zeroed (positive or negative)  Pending items cleared  Debits, stop orders, card transactions  Product closures  Cards, savings pockets, access channels  Data retention  Account closed but data retained per law  Relationship terminated  This path is clean, fast, and well-controlled.  5. Offboarding WITH Credit (High Risk, High Constraint)  This is where the real complexity and your identified risk live.  5.1 Core legal reality  Under South African law:  A credit agreement survives account closure  The bank must continue to service, collect, and administer the loan  The bank cannot orphan the client relationship  Therefore:  Capitec cannot “offboard” a credit client in the normal sense. It can only transition them into a restricted, credit-centric relationship state.  6. What Actually Happens: Managed Restriction Model  Instead of full exit, Capitec applies a Managed Exit / Restricted State (even if not formally named as such).  6.1 Transactional capability is reduced  Cards may be cancelled  Digital banking access restricted  Incoming funds may be limited or ring-fenced  6.2 Credit remains fully active  Loan continues under original contract  Statements must still be issued  Payment mechanisms must remain available  Collections, legal, or restructuring processes continue  6.3 Client is no longer “commercially active”  No upsell  No new products  No discretionary services  This creates a zombie relationship:  Not an active client, not fully exited.  7. Credit-Specific Exit Scenarios 7.1 Loan fully repaid  Credit agreement closes  Client becomes eligible for full offboarding  Normal closure process resumes  7.2 Legal resolution  Debt written off  Judgment settled  Insolvency finalised  Only after one of these events can Capitec fully terminate the relationship.  8. Data, Compliance, and Audit Controls  Even after offboarding:  Client data is retained per statutory timelines  Credit records remain reportable to bureaus  Audit trails must remain intact  Regulator access must be supporte

steps.description: Offboarding process initiated.
Identify offboarding triggers (Client-initiated, Bank-initiated, Credit-driven).
Segment client (product mix, credit status, legal status, risk flags, portfolio) to determine legal allowance.
Does the client have active credit facilities?
Apply Managed Restriction Model (reduce transactional capability, credit remains active, client no longer commercially active).
Has the credit been fully repaid or legally resolved (e.g., written off, judgment settled, insolvency finalised)?
Close credit agreement.
Resume normal offboarding steps (product closures, data management).
Relationship terminated and client data retained per statutory timelines (post-credit resolution).
Settle account balances (zeroed) and clear pending items (debits, stop orders, card transactions).
Close all associated products (cards, savings pockets, access channels).
Relationship terminated and client data retained per statutory timelines (no active credit).

steps.description: Customer initiates the account opening process (e.g., in-branch, online).
Customer provides necessary documentation (ID, proof of address) and personal details.
Bank Representative reviews provided documents, verifies identity, and enters customer data into the system.
System performs automated identity verification, compliance checks (AML, KYC), and credit checks.
Are all checks successful and is the application approved?
Bank Representative finalizes account setup, assigns account numbers, and prepares welcome documents.
Bank Representative offers and sets up additional services (e.g., online banking, debit card, mobile app access).
Customer signs the account agreement and receives the welcome pack with account details.
Account Successfully Onboarded.
Bank Representative informs the customer of the application rejection, providing reasons if legally permissible.
Application Rejected.

versions.content: Hello hello, hello.
Hello there! How can I assist you today?
explain yout purpose

Hello! My purpose is to serve as an expert Business Process Analyst and AI assistant. I can perform two main functions:

1.  **Extract Business Processes:** If you describe a business process, I will analyze it and provide a structured process model in JSON format, complete with actors, steps, and their flow.
2.  **Answer General Questions:** If you ask a general question, I will provide a helpful and informative response.

My goal is to help you understand and model business processes efficiently!
generate a banking onboarding process
generate a banking onboarding process

sessions.title: New Chat
sessions.transcript: generate a design making process for a point of sale system in a restaurant with 3 starter options,  mains and 2 desserts.

steps.description: Customer is seated and ready to order.
Takes Customer's order for Starters, Mains, and optionally Desserts (3 Starters, multiple Mains, 2 Desserts available).
Enters all chosen items into the POS System.
Is the order confirmed by Customer and ready to be sent to the Kitchen?
Makes necessary modifications to the order in the POS System (e.g., adding/removing items, changing quantities).
Sends the confirmed order details to the Kitchen Display System (KDS) or printer.
Prepares the food items according to the order.
Serves prepared courses to the Customer as they are ready.
Generates the bill from the POS System upon Customer's request.
Presents the bill to the Customer.
Provides payment for the bill.
Processes payment through the POS System (e.g., cash, card).
Records the transaction, updates inventory, and closes the order.
Customer leaves the restaurant.

versions.content: explain your purpose

I am an AI assistant designed to help you with two main tasks:

1.  **Extracting and modeling business processes:** If you provide me with a description of a business process, I can analyze it and represent it in a structured format (like BPMN or a similar flowchart logic) including the process name, actors involved, and a sequence of steps (start, action, decision, end). This helps in understanding, analyzing, and optimizing how work gets done.

2.  **Answering general questions:** I can also provide helpful information and explanations on a wide range of topics, acting as a knowledge base.
generate a business process for a credit application for a banking
generate a business process for a credit application for a banking
generate a business process for a credit application for a banking
generate a business process for a credit application for a banking
generate a business process for a credit application for a banking

explain your purpose
explain your purpose

As an AI assistant expert in Business Process Analysis, my purpose is twofold:

1.  **Extract Business Processes:** When you provide a transcript or description of a business process, I will identify the key actors, steps, decisions, and outcomes, and then model it in a structured JSON format.
2.  **Answer General Questions:** If you have general questions related to business processes, AI, or other topics, I will do my best to provide helpful and informative answers.

My ultimate goal is to help you understand, document, and potentially optimize business operations by clearly defining their underlying processes.

As an expert Business Process Analyst and AI assistant, my purpose is to either extract a business process from your transcript and model it in a structured JSON format, or to answer your general questions helpfully and informatively. When extracting a process, I identify actors, steps, and decision points, providing a clear, actionable model. When answering general questions, I strive to provide accurate and concise information.
faillen. I don't know who they might. So I just say hello, hello, hello.

It seems like you're describing a personal interaction where you're trying to get someone's attention. If you'd like me to extract a business process, please describe it with a clear goal and a sequence of steps. For example, 'When a customer places an order, first we check inventory, then we process payment, and finally, we ship the product.'
generate credit application process for a bank

generate a process for a bank base on these engine rules: I am going to give you all the business rules & statuses that i am aware of, i want you to create the decision table: 1. Trigger 2. Compliance Status 3. Product Type 4. Product Status 5. Balance Status 6. Block Status Trigger Routes Product Routes Trigger_ID Trigger_Type Trigger_Rules Compliance Status ID Compliance Status Compliance Status Rule Product Type ID Product Type Product Type Rule Product Status ID Product Status Product Status Rule Balance Status ID Balance Status Balance Status Rule Block Status ID Block Status Block Status Rule Trigger_ID Trigger_Type Compliance Status ID Compliance Status Product_Type_ID Product_Type Product_Status ID Product_Status 1-AML AML 2-HEALTHY HEALTHY 3-BUSINESS_TRANSACT BUSINESS_TRANSACT 4-ACTIVE ACTIVE 5-POSITIVE_DB POSITIVE_DB 6-STOP.50 Suspicious and unconfirmed fraudulent account Account is stopped.No Credits and Debits allowed. T.AML AML CS.ASP AML_SUSPECT PT.BTR BUSINESS_TRANSACT PS.ACT ACTIVE 1-FRD FRAUD a. Fraud is triggered when the fraud team receives an eamail claiming fraud on their dedicated email adress. b. A case is created in Salesforce. c. i) The fraud team investigates this & populates the Fraud Terminations Template, ii) during which the related accounts are checked on BaNCS and a STOP50 is placed iii) the prescribed termination dates (+3 days) are noted for each product. iv) A decision is made & documented whether funds are availble, the amount & whether it will be Re-imbursed, along with v) whether there are outstanding funds to be collected. d. If fraud require related party checks or statement monitoring for further investigation, this will be routed to AML. e.) Complex cases are deliberated weekly in a Fraud Forum where decisions are made & notated. f. i) Fraud then obtains Two signatures from Fraud managers on the template, along with one signature from an AML,ii) if the Fraud suspect is cleared the stop50 must be lifted, if found guilty a stop 73 must be placed. g.(Product Routing Rules) i) The termination notice(es) is/are routed to the account maintenance team if a Transact Account, ii) Forex account maintenance if Forex, iii) Credit & Collections & Legalif Credit, iv) Merchant Services if Merchant Account, v) Rental Finance if Rental Finance Account, & vi) If TPMM Account, Route to TPMM 2-ODD_NON_COMPLY ODD_NON_COMPLY 3-BUSINESS_CREDIT BUSINESS_CREDIT 4-INACTIVE INACTIVE Apply Dormancy Classifications to each product, then trigger standard dormancy account termination process a 5-NEGATIVE_DB NEGATIVE_DB a. Negative Debit Balances less than R2,000 wil be writte off. b. Between R2,000 & R10,000 routed to Internal Collections. c. Greater than R10,000 to External Debt Collections. 6-STOP.73 Confirmed fraudulent account Account is stopped, No Credits and Debits allowed CS.ACL AML_CLEARED PS.INA INACTIVE 1-ODD ODD 2-AML_NON_COMLY AML_NON_COMLY 3-BUSINESS_INVEST BUSINESS_INVEST 5-POSITIVE_CB POSITIVE_CB a.Funds must be returned to Account Holder. CS.ANC AML_NON_COMLY PS.BLK BLOCKED 1-RISK RISK_APPETITE 2-FRAUD_NON_COMPLY FRAUD_NON_COMPLY 3-BUSINESS_FOREX BUSINESS_FOREX 5-NEGATIVE_CB NEGATIVE_CB a. Negative Credit Balances less than R2,000 wil be writte off. b. Between R2,000 & R10,000 routed to Internal Collections. c. Greater than R10,000 to External Debt Collections. CS.DNDB DNDB PS.POSDB POSITIVE_DB 1-DECEASED DECEASED 2-DNDB DNDB 3-BUSINESS_MERCHANT BUSINESS_MERCHANT T.FRD FRAUD CS.FSP FRAUD_SUSPECT PS.NEGDB NEGATIVE_DB 2-AML_SUSPECT AML_SUSPECT 3-BUSINESS_RENTAL BUSINESS_RENTAL CS.FCL FRAUD_CLEARED PT.BCR BUSINESS_CREDIT PS.ACT ACTIVE 2-FRAUD_SUSPECT FRAUD_SUSPECT 3-BUSINESS_TPMM BUSINESS_TPMM CS.FNC FRAUD_NON_COMPLY PS.INA INACTIVE 2-ODD_RISK ODD_RISK CS.DNDB DNDB PS.BLK BLOCKED 2-AML_CLEARED AML_CLEARED T.DOR DORMANCY CS.DOR DORMANT PS.POSCB POSITIVE_CB 2-FRAUD_CLEARED FRAUD_CLEARED T.ODD ODD CS.OSP ODD_RISK PS.NEGCB NEGATIVE_CB 2-ODD_REMEDIATED ODD_REMEDIATED CS.ORM ODD_REMEDIATED PT.BIN BUSINESS_INVEST PS.ACT ACTIVE CS.ONC ODD_NON_COMPLY PS.INA INACTIVE PS.BLK BLOCKED PT.BFX BUSINESS_FOREX PS.ACT ACTIVE PS.INA INACTIVE PS.BLK BLOCKED PT.BMS BUSINESS_MERCHANT PS.ACT ACTIVE PS.INA INACTIVE PS.BLK BLOCKED PT.BRF BUSINESS_RENTAL PS.ACT ACTIVE PS.INA INACTIVE PS.BLK
